intro.title: PROFILE & PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
intro.description: After 8 years of playing online poker professionally, I am transitioning to the web development space. Although I greatly enjoy playing poker, I am seeking a different lifestyle and work/life balance. I've always been interested in technology and decided it was the right time in my career to make the transition. I am a self-taught developer, and I have relied heavily on tutorials and support from the community throughout my learning process. The diversity of the skills I have acquired so far are outlined below in the Projects section. I am looking forward to my first professional opportunity in the Cloud space.

poker.title: PROFESSIONAL POKER PLAYER
skillset: Run PostgreSQL database queries of over 2 million hands to identify and improve inconsistencies in strategy utilizing a game theory optimal framework
Continually learn new strategies using Solver Software and applying it to real-life situations
Manage risk and grow bankroll through diversification of game type and stakes
Developed a strong growth mindset by working with a mental game coach in order to consistently perform at a high level

list.title: CLOUD RESUME
list.description: The project is the website you are currently on. The frontend is built with React, TailwindCSS, and custom CSS. The backend utilizes AWS services such as S3, CloudFront, Route 53, DynamoDB, API Gateway, Python Lambda Functions, and SAM Templates. For a more detailed explanation of how I built this, click the link above.

list.title: TOP 10 CRYPTO DATA
list.description: This project was made in React and pulls live data from the CryptoCompare API. It allows the user to sort cryptocurrencies by daily dollar change or daily percentage change.

list.title: SERVERLESS MESSAGING APPLICATION
list.description: This project was built using a variety of AWS services: Step Functions, Lambda Functions, API Gateway, Simple Notification Service (SNS), Simple Email Service (SES), and S3. To read more about how I built this, click the blog link above.

list.title: HYBRID DNS
list.description: In this project, I used AWS Route 53 to create a hybrid Domain Name System (DNS) between the AWS network and a customer's network. To read more about how I built this, click the blog link above.

list.title: WED IDENTITY FEDERATION
list.description: In this project, I created Google authentication to access my privately stored files on an AWS S3 bucket. It was displayed on a static website hosted on S3. To read more about how I built this, click the blog link above.

list.title: SITE-TO-SITE VPN
list.description: I built a secure VPN connection between the AWS network and a customer's network using the Border Gateway Protocol for routing. To read more about how I built this, click the blog link above.
